title: Cloud Architecture Center - Delete your project
abstract:
# Cloud Architecture Center - Delete your project
Last reviewed 2023-07-05 UTC
This page describes what can happen if you delete a project before you delete its associated Cloud Volumes Service volumes.
content:
## About project deletion
If you [delete your customer project](/resource-manager/docs/creating-managing-projects#shutting_down_projects) without first deleting the Cloud Volumes Service volumes associated with it, the storage and network resources used by your project are kept but are unusable for a 30-day recovery period. The 30-day recovery period lets you [restore the project](/resource-manager/docs/creating-managing-projects#restoring_a_project) if needed. To delete all project resources sooner, [delete](/architecture/partners/netapp-cloud-volumes/delete) all Cloud Volumes Service volumes before deleting the project.
## What's next
- [Support and troubleshooting](/architecture/partners/netapp-cloud-volumes/support) 
- Explore reference architectures, diagrams, and best practices about Google Cloud. Take a look at our [Cloud Architecture Center](/architecture) .
